META.head: El and Al
META.description: Etymological research has always fascinated me. El and Al are two religiously significant words, and here is my research on them. Interestingly, there are similar words in Tamil that influence the meanings of these terms.

META.head: Bermuda Grass
META.description: This article explores the cultural, religious, and etymological significance of Bermuda Grass (Cynodon dactylon), particularly in Southern India. It discusses its connections to mythology, and the linguistic origins of its scientific name.

META.head: Bamboo Etymology
META.description: The article provides an exploration of the cultural, linguistic, and symbolic aspects of bamboo and its connections to Tamil traditions and language, blending personal experiences with etymological insights.

META.head: Marsupial
META.description: Whenever I hear words, I often relate them to ancient Tamil words. If I take one more step to research, I usually uncover the potential origin of the word. For instance, marsupial is a word I am researching in this article.
